definition: angry youth/positive term used to describe young Chinese with extreme nationalistic tendencies/see also 糞青|粪青[fen4 qing1]
abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province

sentences.english: One of the more sinister-sounding behaviours of China's angry youth online is the 'human flesh search engine'.
sentences.chinese: “人肉搜索”是中國憤青們比較惡毒的手段之一。

sentences.english: This article was on a Fenqing have launched an attack on public opinion.
sentences.chinese: 而這文章一出就遭到憤青們發起了一輪的輿論攻擊。
如今他稱這些網民爲“憤青”和“腦殘”。

sentences.english: If I do not impose this sentence someone should say I am anger blueness .
sentences.chinese: 我要是不加上這句話又有人該說我是憤青了。

sentences.english: Angry yung man of many tkink of him as graven image after die.
sentences.chinese: 死後成爲衆多憤青追捧的偶像。

sentences.english: Rumors is carried by chatters, spread by fools, and accepted by idiots.
sentences.chinese: 流言寄生於灌水，被馬甲傳播，被憤青認可。

sentences.english: My friend is also slightly tinged with a touch of cynicism and a lot of independence.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友很獨立，也有一點那麼“憤青”。

definition: frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to swear or curse (at people)/to scold or yell at someone
"sensational headline writers", people who write misleading titles in order to generate clicks from Internet users/clickbait
to post (an item on a forum)
(typically followed by 就[jiu4]) apt to (lose one's temper, catch a cold etc)/at the drop of a hat
to take one's seat according to the ticket number/(fig.) to put (things or people) in their right place/to take a general comment as a personal attack
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
